intro: Scandix blepharicarpa, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Its leaves are pinnately lobed and have a distinctive, often hairy texture. The flowers are small and yellow, producing a capsule fruit that contains numerous tiny seeds.
